controls.mouse: Click and drag to rotate view

header.title: About Our Mission
header.description: We are explorers, dreamers, and builders charting a course through the digital cosmos. Our mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible in the universe of technology.

bio.p1: I'm Luna, Team Leader and Data Scientist with a passion for exoplanet research. Leading our mission through data analysis and innovative ML models.
bio.p2: Specialized in harmonizing NASA datasets and building prediction pipelines that help discover new worlds beyond our solar system.
bio.p3: Dedicated to making space exploration accessible through technology and sharing knowledge with future generations of scientists.

bio.p1: I'm María Camila, Data Scientist focused on astronomical pattern recognition. Transforming cosmic data into actionable insights.
bio.p2: Expert in feature engineering and model optimization, ensuring our predictions are both accurate and interpretable.
bio.p3: Passionate about bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world space discoveries.

bio.p1: I'm Leonardo, Frontend Developer creating intuitive interfaces for space data visualization. Making the cosmos accessible through design.
bio.p2: Specialized in 3D visualization with Three.js and building responsive experiences that bring exoplanets to life.
bio.p3: Committed to user experience and making complex space data beautiful and easy to understand.

bio.p1: I'm Michael, but my friends call me Maic. Data Scientist with a focus on ML model development and optimization.
bio.p2: Building robust prediction systems using LightGBM and scikit-learn to identify potential exoplanet candidates.
bio.p3: Contributing to open source projects and helping the community advance in machine learning and space tech.

bio.p1: I'm Mauro, Fullstack Developer and Data Scientist. Building the bridge between data pipelines and user interfaces.
bio.p2: Expert in creating scalable systems with FastAPI and Nuxt, ensuring our platform performs at stellar speeds.
bio.p3: DevOps enthusiast automating deployments and making sure our space exploration tools are always available.

orbital_period.label: Orbital Period
orbital_period.description: Time for one complete orbit (in days)

transit_duration.label: Transit Duration
transit_duration.description: Duration of the transit event (in hours)

transit_depth.label: Transit Depth
transit_depth.description: Transit depth in parts per million (ppm)

insolation_flux.label: Insolation Flux
insolation_flux.description: Stellar flux received by the planet (S⊕)

stellar_radius.label: Stellar Radius
stellar_radius.description: Host star radius in solar radii (R☉)

source_mission.label: Source Mission
source_mission.description: Space telescope mission that discovered the candidate

koi_fpflag_nt.label: Not Transit-Like
koi_fpflag_nt.description: Flag set if the light curve is not consistent with a transiting planet

koi_fpflag_ss.label: Stellar Eclipse
koi_fpflag_ss.description: Flag set if the transit event is a stellar eclipse (secondary eclipse)

koi_fpflag_co.label: Centroid Offset
koi_fpflag_co.description: Flag set if the transit source is offset from the target star

koi_fpflag_ec.label: Ephemeris Match
koi_fpflag_ec.description: Flag set if the transit shares the same period/epoch as another object

validation.stellar_temp_min: Stellar temperature must be at least 1000 K
validation.orbital_period_range: Orbital period must be between 0.45 and 570 days
validation.transit_duration_range: Transit duration must be between 0.49 and 23 hours
validation.planet_radius_range: Planet radius must be between 0.59 and 156 Earth radii
validation.equilibrium_temp_range: Temperature must be between 0 and 29,339 K
validation.transit_depth_range: Transit depth must be between 0 and 357,953 ppm
validation.insolation_flux_range: Insolation flux must be between 0 and 40,519 S⊕
validation.stellar_radius_range: Stellar radius must be between 0.25 and 8.06 R☉
validation.stellar_temp_range: Stellar temperature must be between 3,218 and 8,992 K

predict.error: Error processing prediction. Please try again.

result.title: Prediction Result
result.description: Analysis of exoplanet candidate based on the provided parameters

interpretation.title: Interpretation
interpretation.high: High confidence that this is a genuine exoplanet. The characteristics strongly match confirmed exoplanets.
interpretation.medium: Moderate confidence. Further observation and analysis may be needed to confirm this candidate.
interpretation.low: Low confidence. The signal characteristics suggest this is likely a false positive or instrumental artifact.
